parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be directly linked to an officially registered campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post mentions "Manolache Vasile Senator" in the hashtags.  This clearly refers to a specific candidate, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The use of hashtags further amplifies its public reach, satisfying Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's core message urges viewers to vote for "leaders who put health first" on December 1st. While not explicitly naming Manolache Vasile, the hashtags strongly link the message to his candidacy. The call to action ("hai să votăm") directly aims to influence voting behavior, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c. The overall objective is clearly to garner votes for Manolache Vasile.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a specific viewpoint and encourages a particular voting choice.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted message designed to persuade voters. The use of paid advertising further reinforces its promotional intent.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>946591617530257</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, promotes Manolache Vasile's candidacy for Senator.  It directly encourages voters to support him by highlighting the need for improved healthcare and linking this issue to his platform. The post's design, hashtags, and call to action clearly aim to influence the election outcome.  While it doesn't explicitly mention the election date, the reference to December 1st, coupled with the context of the Romanian parliamentary elections, makes the intent clear. The post fulfills all criteria of Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, defining it as electoral propaganda.  The fact that it was published after the official campaign period ended (assuming the end date in the metadata is accurate) constitutes a violation of Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015. The reach of the post (8K-9K impressions, 100K-500K reach estimate) further underscores its potential impact on the election.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Manolache Vasile</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 946591617530257) cu caracter de propagandă electorală, care promovează candidatura lui Manolache Vasile la Senat, îndemnând la vot în favoarea sa prin sublinierea necesităţii îmbunătăţirii sistemului sanitar.  Postarea, cu un buget de sub 100 RON, a generat între 8.000 și 9.000 de impresii și o estimare a acoperirii de 100.000 - 500.000 de persoane, având un efect electoral clar prin influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului.  Mesajul "Pe 1 decembrie, hai să votăm pentru lideri care să pună sănătatea pe primul loc" și hashtag-urile "#ManolacheVasileSenator #SănătatePentruRomânia #SpitaleModerne #ViitorMaiBun" demonstrează intenția de a influența votul.  Contact: contact@momentum.com.ro, +40767277777.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
